title: Thomas Vroylandt
text:
Hi, I’m Thomas 




Welcome to my personal website !
I’m a data everything from France (replace with analyst/scientist or whatever you prefer). I work as an independant consultant (in fact with my wife) @Kantiles.
I often work with R for the Rest of Us.
 You can reach me at thomas@kantiles.com
I like to build reports by hundreds, create dashboards that won’t break your mind or your computer, refine data workflow or simply help people to do a better job with data.
 My toolbox includes R, Quarto, Python, JavaScript (mostly Observable) and some styling languages like HTML or CSS.
Checkout my work:
About PDF reporting:

quarto.report is a Quarto extension to produce better PDF reports without using LaTeX and without to lost your sanity. It’s the successor or pagedreport
Some clients made our work public, see:

IA2030 for IVAC & WHO

 

Oregon Voices for TFFF

 

Housing Data Profiles for PSC Housing

 

On the interactive side:

I did some interactive dashboard with Observable too
I also made some data exploration with MapLibre and JS


If you came here after UseR 2024 of the Rencontres R, here are my talks :

UseR 2024 about parametrized reporting
Rencontres R 2024 about Excel data cleaning
Rencontres R 2021 about creating a template with {pagedown}

On my freetime I like to run and take care of my children (or just trying to survive to this mess they create everyday).

title: About
text: Quick summary about myself. Please reach out of find my LinkedIn profile or articles section to know more.

title: About
text:
Professional experiences
2023-present: Co-Founder and Consultant - Kantiles
2020-present: Consultant - R for the Rest of Us
2019-present: Independant data everything
2021-2024: Data scientist - Unedic, organization in charge of unemployment policy
2017-2021: Statisticien - Pole emploi, agency in charge of unemployment
2015-2017: Statistician and survey manager - Ministry of Social Affairs
2015: Assistant researcher in political sciences - Strasburg University

title: About
text:
Education
2019: Cartography with R - ThinkR
2015: Msc in Quantitative Sociology - ENS, EHESS, ENSAE
2013: Bsc in History - Burgundy University
2013: Bsc in Sociology - Burgundy University

title: About
text:
Teaching
2019: Mapping with R - Internal
2019: Data cleaning with R - Internal
2018-2019: Introduction to quantitative methods - Catholic Institute of Paris
